result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea K Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of conviction 
Crt extends probation for 1 yr or until Anger Management programming (if deemed appropriate by agent based upon behavior after 9/13/17) and 40 hrs of community service are completed.   Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.

Defendant appeared.  Allison E. Cogbill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Chelsey Keen, not at counsel table, in court. DE has not completed community service and anger management classes. DE claims she completed the community service. Ct does not deem community service completed and DE informed she needs to complete the community service requirement. Ct extends supervision for 1 year. Anger management to be left up to agent with conditions stated on record. Early termination of probation with completion of community service and decision as to anger management by agent.
